channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：唐纳德-格雷厄姆（Donald E. Graham）写道：将股市收益和亏损视为收益，即使不是毫无意义，也会使任何公司的业绩变得混乱不堪
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Treating stock-market gains and losses as earnings makes any corporation’s results confusing if not meaningless, writes Donald E. Graham https://t.co/tuLzUw810n https://t.co/tuLzUw810n

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 一个多世纪以来，社会一直认为反社会病症是不可治疗和不可救赎的。经过多年的研究和治疗，我可以说反社会者并不 "坏"、"邪恶 "或 "疯狂"。我们的行为是为了填补空虚，帕特里克-加涅写道。
item.description:
For more than a century, society has deemed sociopathy untreatable and unredeemable. After years of study and therapy, I can say that sociopaths aren’t “bad” or “evil” or “crazy.” We act out to fill a void, writes Patric Gagne. https://t.co/ir9YznyW2A https://t.co/ir9YznyW2A

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：在国情咨文中，拜登在我国的关键时刻毫无必要地侮辱、诱导和冒犯了重要的政治人物，在贬低他们的同时也贬低了自己。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: In his State of the Union address, Biden needlessly insulted, baited and offended important political players at a critical moment for our country, diminishing himself as he belittled them, writes @KarlRove https://t.co/8NVRbvPJpP https://t.co/8NVRbvPJpP

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 最近几周，黄金价格飙升至历史新高。现在，投资者面临的问题是，价格上涨能否持续。
item.description:
Gold prices have surged to record highs in recent weeks. Now, the question for investors is whether rising prices can persist. https://t.co/TIVfcztBlP https://t.co/TIVfcztBlP

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 语言课、鹦鹉邂逅、水球大战--这些都是豪华度假村儿童俱乐部中孩子们的必修课。
item.description:
Language lessons, parakeet encounters and water-balloon fights—they're all part of the experience for children dropping into kids clubs at luxury resorts https://t.co/jSPVgL1mi5 https://t.co/jSPVgL1mi5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：今年的总统选举，美国公众需要的是一场有理有据的选举。相反，法律机会主义可能会投下最大的一票，@DanHenninger 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The American public needed a presidential election this year on the merits. Instead, legal opportunism may cast the biggest vote, writes @DanHenninger. https://t.co/ntH88QXOFb https://t.co/ntH88QXOFb

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 黑客会不会通过在训练数据中下毒，让生成式人工智能工具干坏事？一些研究人员认为会。
item.description:
Could hackers get generative AI tools to do something bad by poisoning their training data? Some researchers think so. https://t.co/MIBgq1sIna https://t.co/MIBgq1sIna

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：拜登政府是时候认清现实了：绝大多数巴勒斯坦人支持谋杀犹太人，而以色列人认为巴勒斯坦人不配拥有一个国家，@amitsegal22 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: It’s time the Biden Administration recognizes reality: The Palestinians overwhelmingly support the murder of Jews, and the Israelis don’t think the Palestinians deserve a state, writes @amitsegal22 https://t.co/M703OnvO9a https://t.co/M703OnvO9a

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 治疗师在你哭泣时对你竖起的大拇指。气球打断公司董事会。这是苹果一项引发混乱的功能的一部分。
item.description:
A thumbs down from your therapist while you’re crying. Balloons interrupting a company board meeting. It's part of an Apple feature that is causing chaos. https://t.co/fJIRLPzeWO https://t.co/fJIRLPzeWO

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 1967 年，根岸重一（Shigeichi Negishi）在自弹自唱时，他的一位员工告诉他，他唱得并不好。于是，卡拉 OK 机诞生了。
item.description:
In 1967, Shigeichi Negishi was singing to himself when one of his employees told him that he wasn’t a very good singer. The karaoke machine was born. https://t.co/kMyq9HXBCg https://t.co/kMyq9HXBCg

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 街谈巷议强劲的工资增长一直是日本保持低利率所缺少的一块拼图，现在终于出现了
item.description:
Heard on the Street: Robust wage gains have been the missing piece of the puzzle keeping Japan’s rates low—now they are finally here https://t.co/adv03IQ1dT https://t.co/adv03IQ1dT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: Apollo、Blackstone 和 KKR 等私人基金管理公司正大举进军资产借贷领域，目标直指全球经济的最大赢家--美国消费者。
item.description:
Private fund managers like Apollo, Blackstone and KKR are pushing into asset-based lending and targeting the global economy’s biggest prize: the U.S. consumer https://t.co/YdYsWgDFar https://t.co/YdYsWgDFar

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 一对夫妇花了很长时间才把一栋破旧的楼房改造成了拥有两间卧室和两间浴室的住宅。等待是值得的。
item.description:
A couple played the long game while transforming a dilapidated building into a two-bedroom, two-bathroom home. It was worth the wait. https://t.co/AWUN5BHnZP https://t.co/AWUN5BHnZP

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 华尔街日报》随美国空军飞越加沙，运送援助物资，帮助巴勒斯坦人应对人道主义灾难
item.description:
The Wall Street Journal flew with the U.S. Air Force as it delivered aid over Gaza to help Palestinians grappling with a humanitarian disaster https://t.co/0m9c9RUmGV pic.twitter.com/NgQczhBPKg

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 以色列军方表示将与美国合作建立一条海上走廊，以便向加沙北部 "大量 "输送援助物资，因为国际社会就饥饿危机对以色列施加的压力越来越大
item.description:
The Israeli military said it would work with the U.S. to set up a sea corridor in an effort to “flood” northern Gaza with aid as international pressure grows on Israel over the hunger crisis https://t.co/98ftSRJKMb https://t.co/98ftSRJKMb

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：TikTok 动员其约 1.7 亿美国用户大军游说国会，反对要求出售 TikTok 的法案。这一噱头可能适得其反。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: TikTok mobilized its army of some 170 million American users to lobby Congress against a bill to require its sale. The stunt may have backfired. https://t.co/WkRgQVtIdW https://t.co/WkRgQVtIdW

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 奥克兰运动家队（Oakland A's）发布了拟在拉斯维加斯建造的新主场的效果图，但关于在此期间的活动和比赛地点的计划细节却少得令人吃惊。
item.description:
The Oakland A’s released renderings for its proposed new home in Las Vegas, but plans for what to do and where to play in the interim are surprisingly light on details https://t.co/id1B7EeXv0 https://t.co/id1B7EeXv0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 今天，军用无人机是一种可控的威胁。埃利奥特-阿克曼（Elliot Ackerman）和詹姆斯-斯塔夫里迪斯（James Stavridis）写道，当数以百计的无人机被人工智能所控制时，它们将成为征服的工具。
item.description:
Today, military drones are a manageable threat. When hundreds of them can be harnessed to AI, they will become a tool of conquest, write Elliot Ackerman and James Stavridis. https://t.co/2GlIkyA3EO https://t.co/2GlIkyA3EO

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 美国商务部（Commerce Department）周四称，经季节性因素调整后，2月份美国零售额环比增长0.6%。
item.description:
U.S. retail sales rose a seasonally adjusted 0.6% in February compared with a month earlier, the Commerce Department said Thursday https://t.co/X7vzNvtT9Y https://t.co/X7vzNvtT9Y

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 美国橄榄球联盟（NFL）自由球员签约仪式开始后的几天里，整个联盟都在疯狂地争夺一个已经贬值的位置，但这个位置仍然拥有一些橄榄球界的大牌球星。
item.description:
The opening days of NFL free agency were marked by a frenzy of activity at a position that has become devalued across the league—but still boasts some of the game’s biggest names. https://t.co/WPjPonGOyT https://t.co/WPjPonGOyT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 埃尔帕索的一家慈善机构和其他信仰组织正受到德克萨斯州政客的法律制裁，他们试图阻止向非法越境者提供援助
item.description:
An El Paso charity and other faith-based organizations are coming into the legal crosshairs of Texas politicians seeking to stop aid to people who have crossed the border illegally https://t.co/TOMtj8f2sW https://t.co/TOMtj8f2sW

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 随着一项法案被提交到参议院，TikTok 的创造者们正在想象一个没有该应用的世界："我就完了"
item.description:
With a bill advancing to the Senate, TikTok creators are now imagining a world without the app: “I’d be done.” https://t.co/hXxjrSUdan https://t.co/hXxjrSUdan

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: @greg_ip 写道：拜登总统关于通货膨胀的说法有一个值得调查的事实核心
item.description:
There is a factual core to President Biden’s claims regarding inflation that merits investigation, @greg_ip writes https://t.co/Plt0JISnDi https://t.co/Plt0JISnDi

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 迈克尔-曼（Michael Mann）是臭名昭著的 "冰棍图 "背后那位饱受争议的气候科学家，他说，在赢得了针对他的两位批评者的 100 万美元诽谤案之后，他对科学的感觉非常好
item.description:
Michael Mann, the embattled climate scientist behind the infamous “hockey-stick graph,” says he’s feeling pretty good about science after winning $1 million in a defamation case against two of his critics https://t.co/1prPbFiKCZ https://t.co/1prPbFiKCZ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 美国太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）周四上午发射了其大型星际飞船火箭，进行了第三次试飞，目的是证明该火箭的航天器能够进入轨道并返回地球。
item.description:
SpaceX launched its massive Starship rocket on its third test flight Thursday morning, aiming to show that the vehicle’s spacecraft can reach orbit and return to Earth https://t.co/LM4Z3IXgvv https://t.co/LM4Z3IXgvv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：福布斯亿万富豪榜上的印度人从 2003 年的 6 位上升到去年的 169 位，这是无可争议的好事。我们应该希望有更多而不是更少的奢华印度婚礼，@dhume 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: It’s incontestable that the rise in the number of Indians on the Forbes list of billionaires from six in 2003 to 169 last year is a good thing. We should hope for more lavish Indian weddings, not fewer, writes @dhume. https://t.co/kZDWd5r4x5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 在比佛利山庄，一座占地约 2.8 万平方英尺的别墅即将以 8500 万美元的价格上市。该别墅被称为 Theos 别墅，其设施堪比主题公园：保龄球馆、夜总会、射击场，甚至还有一个逃生隧道。
item.description:
In Beverly Hills, a roughly 28,000-square-foot compound is coming on the market for $85 million. Known as Villa Theos, it has amenities worthy of a theme park: a bowling alley, nightclub, shooting range, and even an escape tunnel https://t.co/P7ooyTRnds https://t.co/P7ooyTRnds

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 一个多世纪以来，社会一直认为反社会病症是不可治疗和不可救赎的。经过多年的研究和深入治疗，我可以说反社会者并不 "坏"、"邪恶 "或 "疯狂"。我们的行为是为了填补空虚，帕特里克-加涅写道。
item.description:
For more than a century, society has deemed sociopathy untreatable and unredeemable. After years of study and intensive therapy, I can say that sociopaths aren’t “bad” or “evil” or “crazy.” We act out to fill a void, writes Patric Gagne. https://t.co/r9I719dDIb pic.twitter.com/5xJ5hyUf1G

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 以下是今日《华尔街日报》头版的早期报道
item.description:
Here is an early look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/iGHG9LtedK pic.twitter.com/Z6qeNZcNw8

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 我们的手机、电脑和汽车几乎了解我们的一切。拜伦-陶（Byron Tau）写道，现在，数据经纪人正在向美国执法部门和间谍机构出售这些个人信息。
item.description:
Our phones, computers and cars know almost everything about us. Now data brokers are selling that personal information to U.S. law enforcement and spy agencies, writes Byron Tau. https://t.co/1GIxI6SUpR https://t.co/1GIxI6SUpR

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024
